meanings.definition: The act of converting plain text into code.
meanings.sent1: The encipherment of the message made it impossible for others to read.
meanings.sent2: Government agencies often use encipherment to protect sensitive information.
meanings.sent3: The encipherment of the secret recipe kept it safe from prying eyes.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an encipherment, hiding her true feelings behind a mask.
meanings.sent5: The encipherment of the treasure map added an element of mystery to the adventure.

meanings.definition: The process of encoding a message for security purposes.
meanings.sent1: The encipherment of the data ensured it remained confidential.
meanings.sent2: Cybersecurity experts focus on developing advanced encipherment techniques.
meanings.sent3: The encipherment of the love letter made it feel like a top-secret mission.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was an encipherment, hiding his true emotions from others.
meanings.sent5: The encipherment of the lock code kept the vault secure from intruders.
